line_1: That our weak pipes were not within his hearing;
line_2: We pray'd, before our awful judge appearing,

line_1: Or I'll soon go out of hearing.
He'll ridicule no friend, tho' out of hearing:
line_2: One's so good-natur'd, he's beyond all bearing,

line_1: Child! I am rather hard of hearing —
line_2: Well, I protest 'tis past all bearing —

line_1: Gives every idle fop a hearing;
line_2: Which stronger is from not appearing.

line_1: When they judg'd without skill he was still hard of hearing:
line_2: To coxcombs averse, yet most civilly steering,
